articles.author: Evan Gough
articles.title: A Super-Earth (and Possible Earth-Sized) Exoplanet Found in the Habitable Zone - Universe Today
articles.description: This Super-Earth has something to tell us about the exoplanet population, but we need the JWST to reveal what that is.
articles.content: Astronomers have found a new Super-Earth orbiting an M-dwarf (red dwarf) star about 137 light-years away. The planet is named TOI-715b, and it’s about 1.55 Earth’s radius and is inside the star’s hab… [+8773 chars]

articles.author: Andrew Jones
articles.title: Japan's SLIM moon lander may be dead for good as freezing lunar night sets in - Livescience.com
articles.description: Days after being revived from its initial power loss on the moon, Japan's SLIM lander will now sleep through the deep cold of lunar night — and may or may not wake up afterward.
articles.content:
Japan's historic SLIM moon lander has powered down ahead of a likely mission-ending cold lunar nighttime — but not before grabbing some final images and loads of science data.
